types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: The root mutation type which contains root level fields which mutate data.

fields.name: acceptInvitationToOrganization
fields.description: If someone invited you by your email address then you must include the code that was emailed to you, otherwise you may accept the invitation directly using the UUID. If successful, you will be a member of the organization.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: changePassword
fields.description: Enter your old password and a new password to change your password.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: confirmAccountDeletion
fields.description: If you're certain you want to delete your account, use `requestAccountDeletion` to request an account deletion token, and then supply the token through this mutation to complete account deletion.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: createOrganization
fields.description: An `Organization` is a great way of sharing access to resources between multiple users without compromising security. When you create an organization you will have the 'owner' and 'billing contact' roles. You may invite other users and redistribute these roles.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: createUserEmail
fields.description: Creates a single `UserEmail`.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: deleteNote
fields.description: Deletes a single `Note` using a unique key.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: deleteOrganization
fields.description: Only the 'owner' may delete an organization. This operation cannot be undone, so be sure that it is what you intend.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: deleteUserAuthentication
fields.description: Deletes a single `UserAuthentication` using a unique key.

args.name: input

fields.name: deleteUserEmail
fields.description: Deletes a single `UserEmail` using a unique key.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: forgotPassword
fields.description: If you've forgotten your password, give us one of your email addresses and we'll send you a reset token. Note this only works if you have added an email address!

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: inviteToOrganization
fields.description: You may invite a user to your organization either by their username (only for verified users) or by their email. If you opt to invite by email then an email will be sent to this person containing a code that they need to accept the invitation. If the person doesn't already have an account they will be instructed to create one; their account need not have the email address that you invited listed as the secret code is confirmation enough.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: login
fields.description: Use this mutation to log in to your account; this login uses sessions so you do not need to take further action.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: logout
fields.description: Use this mutation to logout from your account. Don't forget to clear the client state!

fields.name: makeEmailPrimary
fields.description: Your primary email is where we'll notify of account events; other emails may be used for discovery or login. Use this when you're changing your email address.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: register
fields.description: Use this mutation to create an account on our system. This may only be used if you are logged out.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: removeFromOrganization
fields.description: The owner of an `Organization` may remove an `OrganizationMember` with this mutation.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: requestAccountDeletion
fields.description: Begin the account deletion flow by requesting the confirmation email

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: resendEmailVerificationCode
fields.description: If you didn't receive the verification code for this email, we can resend it. We silently cap the rate of resends on the backend, so calls to this function may not result in another email being sent if it has been called recently.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: resetPassword
fields.description: After triggering forgotPassword, you'll be sent a reset token. Combine this with your user ID and a new password to reset your password.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: transferOrganizationBillingContact
fields.description: The owner of an `Organization` may use this mutation to make any organization member the billing contact.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

fields.name: transferOrganizationOwnership
fields.description: The owner of an `Organization` may use this mutation to transfer ownership to a different organization member. Take care, if you assign ownership to someone who cannot or will not access their account then you may need to contact support to have ownership reassigned.

args.name: input
args.description: The exclusive input argument for this mutation. An object type, make sure to see documentation for this object’s fields.

args.description: Read all values in the set after (below) this cursor.

args.name: before
args.description: Read all values in the set before (above) this cursor.

args.description: A condition to be used in determining which values should be returned by the collection.

args.name: filter
args.description: A filter to be used in determining which values should be returned by the collection.

args.name: first
args.description: Only read the first `n` values of the set.

args.name: last
args.description: Only read the last `n` values of the set.

args.name: offset
args.description:
Skip the first `n` values from our `after` cursor, an alternative to cursor
based pagination. May not be used with `last`.

args.description: The method to use when ordering `OrganizationMembership`.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Subscription
types.description:
The root subscription type: contains events and live queries you can subscribe to with the `subscription` operation.

#### Live Queries

Live query fields are differentiated by containing `(live)` at the end of their
description, they are added for each field in the `Query` type. When you
subscribe to a live query field, the selection set will be evaluated and sent to
the client, and then most things\* that would cause the output of the selection
set to change will trigger the selection set to be re-evaluated and the results
to be re-sent to the client.

_(\* Not everything: typically only changes to persisted data referenced by the query are detected, not computed fields.)_

Live queries can be very expensive, so try and keep them small and focussed.

#### Events

Event fields will run their selection set when, and only when, the specified
server-side event occurs. This makes them a lot more efficient than Live
Queries, but it is still recommended that you keep payloads fairly small.

types.name: UserAuthentication
types.description: Contains information about the login providers this user has used, so that they may disconnect them should they wish.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: A unique identifier for the user within the login service.

fields.name: service
fields.description: The login service used, e.g. `twitter` or `github`.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Reads a single `User` that is related to this `UserAuthentication`.

types.name: UserAuthenticationCondition
types.description:
A condition to be used against `UserAuthentication` object types. All fields are
tested for equality and combined with a logical ‘and.’

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `id` field.

inputFields.name: service
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `service` field.

inputFields.name: userId
inputFields.description: Checks for equality with the object’s `userId` field.

types.name: UserAuthenticationFilter
types.description: A filter to be used against `UserAuthentication` object types. All fields are combined with a logical ‘and.’

inputFields.name: and
inputFields.description: Checks for all expressions in this list.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Filter by the object’s `id` field.

inputFields.name: not
inputFields.description: Negates the expression.

inputFields.name: or
inputFields.description: Checks for any expressions in this list.

inputFields.name: service
inputFields.description: Filter by the object’s `service` field.

inputFields.name: userId
inputFields.description: Filter by the object’s `userId` field.

types.name: UserEmail
types.description: Information about a user's email address.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The users email address, in `a@b.c` format.

fields.name: isVerified
fields.description: True if the user has is_verified their email address (by clicking the link in the email we sent them, or logging in with a social login provider), false otherwise.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Reads a single `User` that is related to this `UserEmail`.

types.description: Represents an update to a `User`. Fields that are set will be updated.

An arbitrary string value with no semantic meaning. Will be included in the

unchanged and unused. May be used by a client to track mutations.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
